Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in declaring the applicant's refugee claim abandoned under s. 69.1(6) of the Immigration Act
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's testimony regarding intent to continue claim
Board's finding of unpreparedness and absence from hearing
Decision_Outcome: Claim declared abandoned by the Board
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate that claim was not abandoned
Credibility_Factor: Applicant claimed he was misled by inadequate notice
Legal_Rule: A refugee claim may be declared abandoned if the claimant fails to appear, provide information, or defaults in prosecution after a reasonable opportunity to be heard
Procedural_Issue: Premature end of hearing due to conflict between Board and counsel
Grounds_for_Claim: Material factual error by the Board
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board's process found procedurally unfair due to inadequate notice and failure to ensure proper hearing conditions
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant’s presence and departure from January 28, 1998 hearing
Testimony about intent to continue claim
Court_Result: Decision set aside; matter remitted for rehearing before a different panel
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Board's abandonment decision
Remedy_Sought: Rehearing of refugee claim on its merits
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative rehearing
